intro: Jaltomata biflora, commonly known as the twin-flowered jaltomata, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy, glandular leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high elevations. Jaltomata biflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
